text: What is the minimum visibility required for VFR flight in Class G airspace below 3,000 ft AMSL or 1,000 ft AGL, whichever is higher?
explanation: According to CAR Section 9 Series L Part IV, the minimum flight visibility for VFR in Class G airspace below 3000ft AMSL or 1000ft AGL is 5 km.
reference: CAR Section 9 Series L Part IV

text: Which document must a pilot carry on all flights?
explanation: Pilots are required to carry their license, valid medical certificate, and a government-issued photo ID while exercising the privileges of their license.

text: What does the signal shown in the image (a flashing white light directed towards an aircraft in flight) signify?
explanation: A flashing white light from ATC directed at an aircraft in flight signals the pilot to return to the starting point on the aerodrome (return for landing).
reference: CAR Section 9 Series B Part I - Appendix A
